definition: a seat (in a theater, stadium etc)/parliamentary or congressional seat
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Many others will be filled by “retired” army officers.
sentences.chinese: 另有許多席位留給了“退役的”軍職人員。

sentences.english: This gave us a seat in the European parliament for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 這也讓我們首次在歐洲議會中獲得了一個席位。

sentences.english: Five of the new seats will be directly elected, representing geographical constituencies.
sentences.chinese: 新增加席位中有五人來自直選，分別代表各個選區。

sentences.english: In this sense, Pakatan Rakyat and SAPP can work out and agree on the seat allocation.
sentences.chinese: 這樣民聯和進步黨就能夠互相商定席位的分配。

sentences.english: The most hotly contested seats were for Western Europe.
sentences.chinese: 競爭最激烈的席位是西歐地區。

sentences.english: Would you like to make a reservation at another restaurant in the hotel?
sentences.chinese: 您要不要訂本飯店另一家餐廳的席位。

sentences.english: One of the five board seats comes up for appointment each October.
sentences.chinese: 每年的十月，董事會五個中有一個席位開始提名。

sentences.english: The reforms will increase the number of Legco seats to 70 in the next elections.
sentences.chinese: 這項改革會在下次選舉中將議會席位增長至70位。

sentences.english: The Ahmadinejad camp won the largest share of seats in the Majlis, or parliament.
sentences.chinese: 艾哈邁迪內賈德陣營在議會選舉中贏得了最多的席位。

sentences.english: Each state is entitled to two senators.
sentences.chinese: 每個州都有兩個參議員席位。

sentences.english: On average, $4million have been spent for every congressional seat up for election.
sentences.chinese: 國會平均每個待選席位已經花費了400萬美元。

sentences.english: Nine seats in parliament were now in his gift.
sentences.chinese: 議會中的九個席位他有授予權。

sentences.english: The most populated state, California, has fifty-three House seats.
sentences.chinese: 人口最多的州是加利福尼亞州，佔53個席位。

sentences.english: He has regained his starting position with Real Madrid.
sentences.chinese: 他已重新獲得皇馬的正選席位。

sentences.english: At thirty-five, he won a seat in Congress, in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 歲那年，他在華盛頓議會里獲得了一個席位。
木製唱詩班席位，亞眠，法國，1986。

definition: quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
a sure catch/sth one is sure to obtain
to divide into rows/to identify subcategories/to break down into constituent parts/breakdown/disaggregation
